page.title: 01AN INTRODUCTION TO THE BLOCK
page.content: Our 12km square block covers the eastern part of Islington and quite a big area of Hackney.They are both Inner London boroughs north of the Thames.In 1981 Islington's population was 160,890 (a decrease of 20% from 1971).Hackney's was 180,434 (down 18%).Both are densely populated,well over twice the London average of 43 people per hectare.The two are both poorly off for open space. Islington (0.3ha.per 1,000) and Hackney (1.5ha) have much less than other parts of London.The block has a typical inner city town-scape with a mixture of old and new,high and low rise housing.Both suffer from housing shortage.Islington in parts,has been gentrified especially the old squares.There is a great mix of ethnic groupings with 1/4 of the people born outside the U.K.Unemployment is high especially amongst the young.
